Text: Hi SaM. Thanks for the upload . I will appreciate if you could upload DVD RIp of AVATAR EXTENDED 2010. Thanks in advance and always eager for your uploads

@bikybay SaM upped the best dvd sized version of Avatar you will ever find.  FASM is the last stop for movie quality equal to uncompressed rips twice in file size ~8GB.  Anything else in non-HD is already out there and cannot be made better than it already is.
and why would FASM's rip have the same quality as 8gb rips that other people released? I find it hard to believe tbh.
Fasm has their own methods.  Compression is an art.  If you're into video production the concept is easier to grasp.
The 2011-03-01 fasm version looked nicer imo.  The aspect looks funny on this, all squished.

The secret sauce is in pre-processing - intelligent application of denoising (proper denoising) can make a huge difference..

A typical scenario I use for extreme cases:
Topaz Denoise on EVERY FRAME (Photoshop filter)
Temporal smoothing (virtualdub)..

Don't ask about them, go google it.. This ain't a forum.

Calling Avatar "Pocahontas with CGI" is a pretty good comparison, but do you know those demo-discs that were made when dvd-players, surround-sound, and blu-ray each came out? They were made to really show the capabilities of the new tech and were just a mix of sounds and effects to demonstrate how the new stuff is better than the old. Exactly like those except it cost a billion dollars to make.

Has anyone watched this all the way through?

If so, I'm amazed that noone has pointed out that it cuts off before the movie ends. Let me be the first to point it out :)

Great quality though - many thanks to encoders and uploaders.

Wow. Okay so I had high expectations. Too high apparently. I have a 1080p monitor. 1920x1080 resolution. The video doesn't fill the entire screen, as it should. The pixels are horrible. And some of the comments say that this is good? Well, you've clearly never seen a blu ray film. I have movies in 720 from the 1970s that look better than this. That's pretty sad. In conclusion, this is fugly, and a far cry from what it should be.
